description: Construction of garage workshop and bicycle store (following demolition of existing side garage)
subdivision_of_building: Garage to side area of 8 Queen Anne's Grove
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: A722-01, A722-02, A722-03, A722-04, A722-F01 - Fire Safety Plan, A722-L1, A722-M01, A722-M02, A722-M03.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | The external materials for the building hereby approved shall be as specified in the submitted Heritage Statement and Design and Access Statement by Alice Poole Architects (July 2022).

Reason: To ensure that the materials and finishes are of high quality and contribute positively to the visual amenity of the locality in accordance with policies 1.1 (h) (g), 1.2(h), 2.1(c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies ELV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D6 of the London Plan (2021) and section 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | The building hereby permitted shall be used for domestic purposes incidental to the enjoyment of the main dwellinghouse at Flat 1, 8 Queen Annes Grove, Chiswick only and shall not be used for separate habitable accommodation, letting or any commercial use.

Reason: To ensure that the development does not detract from the amenity of the adjoining properties, and to enable the Local Planning Authority to retain control over the use of the building in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B  of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3, D4 and  D6 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| The sound insulation of the building envelope and of any mitigation measures shall ensure that noise from the uses, activities and plant is contained within the building, as assessed according to standards of the Council's SPG10 and criteria of BS8233:2014 and BS4142:2014, at the nearest and most affected noise sensitive premises including external amenity spaces. Any measures required shall be implemented prior to use of the workshop and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical equipment in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of The London Plan (2015), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | All of the proposed rooflights shall be of a conservation style and shall be flush with the roofslope.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
